intro: Hieracium prophantum, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium prophantum is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
